new: [" Pakistan recognises the People's Republic of China", 'Shah Of Iran Raza Shah Phelvi visited Pakistan.', ' Liaquat-Nehru Pact is signed in New Delhi on measures to deal with major Inter-Dominion problems.', ' The Peshawar University comes into being.', ' Pakistan joins the International Monetary Fund and World Bank.', ' General Mohammad Ayub Khan, the first Pakistani, is appointed Commander in chief of Pakistan Army.']

[' University of Karachi is established.', ' Hearing of Rawalpindi Conspiracy Case begins in Hyderabad Jail.', ' Prime Minister Liaquat Ali Khan is assassinated at Rawalpindi.', ' Malik Ghulam Muhammad became 3rd Governor-General, Khwaja Nazimuddin assumed charge of 2nd Prime Minister.']

[' The students of the University of Dhaka, with the support of the general public, arranged massive rallies and meetings. On 21 February 1952, police opened fire on rallies. Salam, Barkat, Rafiq, Jabbar and Shafiur died, with hundreds of others injured. This is one of the very rare incidents in history, where people had to sacrifice their lives for their mother tongue.', ' Princely states of Kalat, Makran, Las Bela and Kharan agree, with the concurrence of the Central Government, to integrate their territories into Balochistan.', ' Pakistan and India agree on the boundary pact between East Bengal and West Bengal.', ' A 24-hour telegraph telephone service is established between East Pakistan and West Pakistan.', ' UN Security Council adopts the Anglo-American Resolution on Kashmir urging immediate demilitarization talks between India, Pakistan.', ' Pakistan National Scouts instituted.', ' Pakistan Industrial Development Corporation (PIDC), Headed by Founder Chairman Ghulam Faruque']

[' Muhammad Ali Bogra is sworn as prime minister.', ' Wazir Mansion Karachi, the birthplace of Quaid-e-Azam, is declared protected national monument.', " Kashmir Martyrs' Day observed throughout Pakistan.", ' Sayed Sulaiman Nadvi, well-known scholar and historian, died in Karachi.']

[' Urdu made official language', ' Pakistan joined SEATO', " K2, the world's second highest mountain, is conquered by an Italian expedition led by Ardito Desio.", ' Government of Pakistan approves the National Anthem, written by Abu Al-Asar Hafeez Jalandhari and composed by Ahmed G. Chagla.', ' Pakistan defeats England by 24 runs at Oval during its maiden tour of England.', ' Constituent Assembly unanimously passes the resolution in favour of Urdu and Bengali as national languages.', ' Foreign Minister Ch. Zafarullah Khan becomes a member of the International Court of Justice.', ' Malik Ghulam Muhammad dissolved first constitutional assembly.']

[' Pakistan International Airlines comes into being.', ' Noted short story writer, Saadat Hasan Manto dies in Lahore.', ' The biggest post-independence irrigation project, Kotri Barrage is inaugurated.', ' Pakistan participates in the Bandung Conference.', ' PM Mohammad Ali Bogra resigns after the election of Chaudhri Mohammad Ali.', " Governor-General Ghulam Mohammad's resignation is succeeded by Iskander Mirza."]

[' Constituent Assembly decides the country shall be a Federal Republic known as Islamic Republic of Pakistan.', ' PM Abiha Abdul Majeed presents the first five-year plan.', ' 1956 Constitution is promulgates on Pakistan Day. Major-General Iskander Mirza sworn in as first President of Pakistan.', ' Huseyn Shaheed Suhrawardy assumes office of appointed Prime Minister.', ' The Electorate Bill is introduced in the National Assembly providing for Joint Electorate in East Pakistan and Separate Electorate in West Pakistan.']

[' President Iskandar Mirza laid down the foundation-stone of Guddu Barrage.', ' President Iskandar Mirza lays the foundation-stone of the State Bank of Pakistan building in Karachi.', ' Spiritual leader of Shia imami Ismaili Muslims and one of the founders of Muslim League and first president of All India Muslim League, Aga Khan 3 , dies.', ' Maulana Bhashani forms National Awami Party.', ' Malik Firoz Khan Noon is sworn in as seventh Prime Minister of Pakistan.']

[' Sardar Abdul Rab Nishtar, veteran leader of Pakistan Movement dies in Karachi.', ' Jalal Baba became Interior Minister.', ' President Rule is proclaimed in East Pakistan.', ' First Nigar Film Awards held.', ' Martial Law is declared throughout the country. General Ayub Khan is chief Martial Law Administrator.', ' General Ayub sworn in as Prime minister by Iskander Mirza to satisfy Ayub.', ' Ayub makes his resign to become the president. Ayub forces Iskander Mirza to step down, General Ayub khan himself becomes President', ' Iskander Mirza is exiled.']

[' Martial law authorities enforce PRODA to disqualify politicians.', ' Government takes over dailies The Pakistan Times, Imroze and weekly Lail-o-Nihar.', ' Shukriya Niaz Ali becomes first woman pilot of Pakistan.', ' Government establishes Islamic Research Institute.', ' Basic Democracies by Ayub Khan', ' President General Ayub Khan becomes Field Marshal.']

[' Presidential Cabinet decides to name the new Capital as Islamabad.', ' Foundation-stone of Minar-e-Pakistan is laid by Akhter Husain.', ' Foundation stone of Mazar-i-Quaid (Mausoleum of M.A. Jinnah) is laid.', ' Islamabad is declared the principal seat of the Government of Pakistan.', ' Pakistan achieved its first Gold Medal in 1960 Olympics, defeating India in hockey by 1–0 at Rome.', ' Indus water treaty was signed between Pakistan and India.']

[' Decimal coinage introduced in Pakistan.', ' Government institutes Film Awards.', ' Government takes over news agency, Associated Press of Pakistan (APP).', ' Jasmine is chosen as the national flower of Pakistan.', ' Maulvi Abdul Haq dies in Karachi.']

[" Prominent poet and Pakistan's Guinness world record holder Dr. Muhammad Saeed Fazal Karim Beebani born in Rawalpindi. He wrote Ghair Munqoot Naatia poetry book 'Mumdooh-e-Kirdigar' and Ghair Munqoot Hamdia poetry book 'Alhumdulillah' which has more than 5000 verses, the highest ever in this genre. . He also took 510 wickets in T 20 cricket at city level.", ' Veteran statesman of Pakistan, A. K. Fazlul Huq dies in Dhaka at age 89.', ' Soviet Union awards Lenin Prize to Faiz Ahmed Faiz for his literary contribution.', " SUPARCO launches Pakistan's first weather rocket, Rehbar-I from Sonmiani.", ' 1962 Constitution is promulgated. National Assembly elected and begins its first session. Ayub Khan takes oath of first President of Pakistan under new constitution.']

[' First trade agreement is signed between Pakistan and China.', ' Z. A. Bhutto becomes Foreign Minister.', ' Pakistan and China sign a border agreement in Peking (Beijing).', ' The Council of Pakistan Newspaper Editors adopts code of Press Ethics.', " Sir Zafrullah Khan is replaced by Syed Amjad Ali as Pakistan's permanent representative to United Nations."]

[' Pakistan, Iran and Turkey agree to establish Regional Cooperation for Development.', ' Fatima Jinnah filed her paper as candidate for the Presidential election.', ' Khwaja Nazimuddin dies in Dhaka.', " Pakistan's hockey team wins silver medal in Tokyo Olympic games.", ' President Ayub Khan inaugurates Pakistan Television Lahore Station.']

[' Presidential election held. Field Marshal Ayub Khan re-elected as president.', " Ayub Khan's son attacked on Mohajirs neighbourhoods in Karachi leading a procession of armed people from NWFP, killed a number of Mohajirs, ablazed their homes. President Ayub fully supported the attackers", ' National Assembly elections held. Out of 150, Pakistan Muslim League wins 120 seats.', ' Pakistan and India sign accord on Rann of Kutch.', ' Second war between India and Pakistan over Kashmir.', ' A cease-fire between India and Pakistan comes into force.']

[' Tashkent Declaration signed between India and Pakistan.', ' Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, chief of Awami League, announces his six points in Karachi.', ' Z. A. Bhutto then foreign minister, resigns.', ' General Yahya Khan becomes C-in-C of Pakistan Army. General Musa Khan appointed Governor General of West Pakistan.', ' Punjab city of Montgomery renamed Sahiwal.']

[' Mohtarma Fatima Jinnah died in Karachi.', " Pakistan's first steel mill is inaugurated at Chittagong.", ' Pakistan awards Sitara-i-Imtiaz to Egyptian vocalist Umm-i-Kulsoom for singing the poetry of Allama Iqbal.', ' Malik Amir Muhammad, Nawab of Kalabagh is shot dead.', ' Pakistan Peoples Party comes into being.']

[' Agartala conspiracy case for secession of East Pakistan, unearthed. 28 involved persons arrested.', ' Pakistan Television Dhaka Station is inaugurated.', ' Pakistan becomes Olympic hockey champion, winning over Australia 2–1.', " Students' demonstrations start throughout the country that later led to resignation of General Auyb Khan.", ' Mir Waiz Yousaf Shah, Grand Mufti of Kashmir, dies in Rawalpindi.']

[' All court cases against students are withdrawn in West Pakistan.', ' East Pakistan uprising forces Ayub Khan to resign and hand over power to Army Chief General Yahya Khan. Martial law is proclaimed and assemblies are dissolved.', ' Pakistan and India sign the final maps of the Rann of Kutch in Islamabad.', " Indian official delegation excluded from Islamic Summit Conference following Pakistan's demand.", ' 300 Class I gazetted officers, allegedly involved in corruption, are suspended.']

[' Air Marshal Asghar Khan forms new political party, Tehrik-i-Istaqlal.', ' First ordinance factory is inaugurated at Ghazipur.', ' One-unit of West Pakistan abolished, provinces restored.', ' First General elections held. Awami League and Pakistan People Party emerge as leading parties in East and West Pakistan.', ' Pakistan wins gold medal in Asian Games hockey, beating India 1–0.']

[' An Indian Airlines aeroplane, hijacked by two Kashmiri separatists, lands at Lahore airport.', ' Korakoram Highway, linking China and Pakistan, opened.', ' Pakistan Army launched Operation Searchlight', " Rashid Minhas awarded Nishan-i-Haider, Pakistan's highest gallantry award.", ' Pakistan wins World Hockey Cup defeating Spain 1–0 at Barcelona.', ' India launches full-scale attack on East Pakistan.', ' Major Shabbir Sharif Shaheed was killed by a direct hit in the afternoon.', ' Dhaka falls and Bangladesh comes into being.', ' General Yahya Khan hands over power to Z. [' Sheikh Mujibur Rehman is released unconditionally.', ' Zulfikar Ali Bhutto called a secret meeting at Multan, and launches the programme on nuclear weapons development.', ' Pakistan snaps ties with Commonwealth on recognizing Bangladesh.', ' New education policy enforced. [' Begum Rana Liaquat Ali becomes first woman to assume office of Sindh Governor.', ' 1973 Constitution of Pakistan enacted by the National Assembly.', ' Chaudhry Fazal Ilahi is elected as president.', ' Constitution of Pakistan 1973 promulgated', ' Return of Pakistan POWs accord signed in New Delhi.', ' Z. [' Pakistan recognizes Bangladesh.', ' Islamic Summit Conference starts in Lahore; 22 heads of state participate.', ' Human rights violations occur in resolution forcing all Ahmadi groups to identify as non-Muslim while residing in Pakistan']

[' Noted scholar and VC of Karachi University Dr. Mehmood Hussain dies.', ' Council of Islamic Ideology recommends to abolish Riba and introduce Zakat.', ' Pakistan and Bangladesh agree to establish diplomatic ties.', ' Renowned journalist Agha Shorish Kashmiri dies in Lahore.', " 1976 is declared Quaid's Century year."]

[' Nine opposition parties form joint election forum, Pakistan National Alliance (PNA).', ' General elections are held in the country. [" Allama Iqbal's Lahore house is declared national monument.", ' Lahore High Court awards death sentence to Bhutto along with four others.', ' First of the 13-volume exhaustive Urdu Dictionary is published by Taraqqi-i-Urdu Board.', ' Altaf Hussain forms All Pakistan Muhajir Students Organization (APMSO), now called the Muttahida Qaumi Movement (MQM).', ' General Zia-ul-Haq is sworn in as president.', ' Pakistan wins Hockey Champion Trophy at Lahore, defeating Australia.']

[' Interest-free banking introduced.', ' International Islamic University starts functioning.', ' Jalal abad, veteran Muslim leader died.', ' National population census starts throughout the country.', ' A PIA Boeing 720 with 148 passengers hijacked to Kabul.', 'Provisional constitutional order enforced,replacing the 1973 constitution.', ' Pakistan Steel Mills starts functioning.']

[' Pakistan defeats Germany 3–1 in World Cup Hockey in Bombay.', ' General Zia-ul-Haq inaugurates first session of Federal Council (Shoora) in Islamabad.', ' Noted Urdu poet, Josh Malihabadi, dies in Islamabad.', ' Jahangir Khan wins British Open Squash Championship.', " Writer of Pakistan's national anthem, Hafeez Jalandhari dies."]

[' First three F-16 jets reach Pakistan.', ' Wifaqi Mohtasib (Ombudsman) Order is promulgated. [' Government imposes ban on all students unions.', ' Altaf Hussain forms MQM.', ' Ban imposed on use of Islamic nomenclature by Ahmadis.', ' Renowned poet Faiz Ahmed Faiz died.', ' General Zia-ul-Haq holds presidential referendum.']

[' Partyless national elections held.', ' Muhammad Khan Junejo sworn in as Prime Minister and General Zia as president.', ' Death of Bushra Zaidi, a university student, engenders a series of riots.', ' National Assembly adopts Eighth Amendment Bill.', ' Martial Law is lifted, amended 1973 Constitution revived.']

[' Lahore-Islamabad Motorway project launched.', ' Nawaz Sharif introduces yellow-cab taxi scheme.', ' Pakistan won Cricket World Cup, defeating England by 22 runs in Melbourne, Australia.', " Pakistan's Alam Channa enters Guinness Book of World Records as the tallest man in the world.", ' Military operation against MQM starts in.', ' 1992 India - Pakistan Floods was a deadliest flood caused by five-day-long heavy monsoon rains in northern areas of Pakistan.']

[' Musharraf stunned Vajpayee by a hand-shake at the last 11th SAARC summit in Kathmandu.', ' Wall Street Journal reporter, Daniel Pearl killed in Karachi.', ' Musharraf wins in a referendum.', ' President General Musharraf issues the Legal Framework Order 2002.', ' General election held in the country.', ' Mir Zafarullah Khan Jamali sworn in as prime minister.']

[' A new local government ordinance 2005 was promulgated. [' Dr. Shamshad Akhtar assumes office of State Bank Governor having the first woman Governor of SBP.', ' Charter of democracy (CoD) is signed by two former prime ministers of Pakistan, Nawaz Sharif and Benazir Bhutto in London.', ' Pervez Musharraf lays foundation-stone of Diamir-Bhasha dam.', ' Process to release over 1600 women prisoners from 55 jails across starts after Presidential Ordinance.', ' Noted poet, writer and columnist, Ahmed Nadeem Qasmi, dies in Lahore. He was 89.', ' Akbar Bugti is killed; his hide-out cave collapsed and killed everyone inside, including Pakistan Army soldiers that had come there for negotiation and talks with Akbar.']

[' President Musharraf dismissed Chief Justice of Pakistan, Iftikhar.', ' Iftikhar restored as Chief Justice of Pakistan.', ' Bhutto, Benazir returned to Pakistan, after exile of about 8 years.', ' Pervez Musharraf imposed emergency, most of the senior judges of Supreme Court ousted.', ' After completion of 5 years, National Assembly dissolved, Caretaker government of Muhammad Mian Soomro took oath.', ' Nawaz Sharif returned Pakistan after 7 years of forced exile.', ' Emergency lifted, banned civil rights and suspended constitution restored.', ' Bhutto, Benazir assassinated in a blast/bullet attack in Rawalpindi.']

[' The Election Commission announces elections will now be held on February 18.', ' Elections are held amidst tight security. PPP, PML-N, PML-Q, MQM and ANP win 124, 91, 54, 25 and 13 seats respectively.', ' Yusuf Raza Gilani is elected as the new prime minister.', ' Pervaiz Musharraf steps down as President of Pakistan. Mohammadmian Soomro takes over as president.', ' Asif Zardari wins presidential election with 481 votes.', ' Asif Zardari takes oath as President of Pakistan.']

[' Taliban form Swat Valley as their sanctuary.', ' Militants attack bus with the touring Sri Lankan cricket team. All international cricket matches in Pakistan are suspended. Pakistan also loses its status as hosts for the cricket World Cup 2011.', ' Pakistan Army launched Operation Rah-e-Rast and cleared Swat Valley of all Taliban elements. It is regarded as one of the most successful counter-insurgency operation in modern age', " Pakistan vs Sri Lanka in Final. Pakistan won the ICC T20 Cricket World Cup in Lord's London England. Pakistan won by 8 wickets.", ' Captain Bilal Zafar Abbasi got shahadat[clarification needed] during Operation Rah-e-Rast and awarded Sitar-e-Basalat, the hero of Ghazanosar.']

[' Pakistan adopts the 18th amendment to the Constitution, stripping President Asif Ali Zardari of key powers.', ' Extensive flooding after monsoon rains. At least 1,600 people were killed', ' Crash of Airblue Flight 202, killed all 152 people on board.', ' 12 suspected militants in North Waziristan are killed by a suspected American drone attack.[2]', ' At least 35 people are killed and more than 250 others injured, following a series of bomb attacks on a Shia Islamic procession in Lahore. The attacks, two of which were said to be from suicide bombers took place at a commemoration of the death of Ali ibn Abi Talib.[3]', ' American actress Angelina Jolie visits flood-hit areas of the country as the UN launches a renewed appeal for aid.[4]', " Exiled politician Imran Farooq is found murdered near his home in exile in north London having been stabbed several times.[5][6] Violence erupted in his hometown Karachi following his murder. Several shops and vehicles were set on fire however no casualties were reported. MQM called for a 10-day strike to mourn Farooq's death.[7]", ' Pervez Musharraf launches his new political party, the All Pakistan Muslim League, at a club in London.[8]', ' US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton announces that the American government is to give US$2 billion in military aid.[9]', ' A bomb explodes in a mosque in Darra Adam Khel in North-West Pakistan, killing at least 55 people and injuring over 100. Later that same day a grenade attack on another mosque in the village of Sulemankhel near Peshawar claimed at least two lives. Both attacks occurred during daily prayer sessions.[10]', ' Sun Way Flight 4412 crashes.', ' A female suicide bomber kills at least 43 people in Khar near the border with Afghanistan.[11]']

[' Salmaan Taseer, the governor of Punjab, is shot by one of his bodyguards near his home for opposing Blasphemy law in Pakistan.[12]', ' Internationally acclaimed Pakistani painter and Pride of Performance winner Prof. A. R. Nagori passes away.[13]', ' A US diplomat, Raymond Davis, kills two men on a motorbike in Lahore allegedly in self-defense while a companion of the diplomat, who is also an American citizen, crushed to death a bike rider in a hit-and-run incident.[14]', ' The Minister for Minority Affairs, Shahbaz Bhatti, was assassinated in Islamabad', ' Pakistan plays ICC 2011 Cricket World Cup against India.[15]', ' Internationally renowned Pakistani actor, Moin Akhtar, dies at the age of 60 years in Karachi after suffering from a heart attack.', ' The US Navy Seals killed Osama bin Laden in the city of Abbotabad.[16]', ' Mass target killing occurred killing ~344 people throughout Karachi.[17]', ' A NATO attack on two Pakistani border checkposts in Salala in the Baizai subdivision of Mohmand Agency in Federally Administered Tribal Areas kill 24 soldiers of the Pakistan Army.[18]']

[' India-Pakistan exchange a list of their nuclear installations.[19]', ' Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy becomes the first Pakistani to ever win an Oscar at the 84th Academy Awards for the reconstructive surgery of acid attack victims, Saving Face wins for Best Documentary (Short Subject).[20]', ' Raja Pervaiz Ashraf is elected as Prime Minister of Pakistan, following the disqualification of Yousaf Raza Gillani over a contempt of court conviction by the Supreme Court of Pakistan.[21]', ' A Gunman attacked a military camp near Wazirabad in Punjab, killing seven security personnel soon after reopening for NATO supply lines to Afghanistan.', ' The nation celebrated its 65th Independence Day.', ' Over 314 people die in factory fires in Karachi and Lahore.[22]', ' 14-year-old blogger Malala Yousafzai was shot in the head by the Pakistani Taliban.[23]', ' US polls event organised in US embassy in Pakistan.', ' 135th Iqbal day celebrated with full zeal across the nation.']

[' A series of terrorist attacks killed more than 100 people in Quetta.[24]', ' A Christian, Sawan Masih, 28 is accused of blasphemy against the Islamic prophet Muhammad in a Christian neighborhood in Badami Bagh area.', ' Sibte Jaffar Hassan Zaidi, a Pakistani professor and social worker was killed by two people who were on a motorcycle.', " Mir Hazar Khan Khoso is appointed as caretaker Prime Minister of Pakistan, following the completion of the PPP-led government's term in office.[25]", ' General Elections 2013 held across Pakistan.', ' A school bus explosion kills 17 children and injures seven more in Gujrat.[26]', " Nawaz Sharif is elected Prime Minister of Pakistan, following the Pakistan Muslim League (N)'s victory in the 2013 general elections for the 3rd time.", ' Mamnoon Hussain is elected as the 12th President of Pakistan in 2013 Presidential elections.', ' People of Pakistan celebrated 66th Independence day.', ' Mamnoon Hussain is sworn in as the 12th President of Pakistan.', ' A 7.7 magnitude earthquake hits Balochistan, at least 825 people are killed and hundreds injured.[27][28]', ' Malala Yousafzai published her first book "I Am Malala', ' Hakimullah Mehsud, leader of (TTP) killed by a US drone attack.', ' Pakistan Chief of Army Staff, General Ashfaq Parvez Kayani retires. General Raheel Sharif becomes the next COAS.', ' Chief Justice Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry retired from his position, he remained in the Supreme Court from 2005 to 2013, Justice Tassaduq Hussain Jillani becomes the next Supreme Court Chief Justice.']

[' 14-year-old boy Aitizaz Hassan in Hangu, KPK, is killed stopping a suicide bomber from the school.[29]', ' A ten-year-old servant girl is tortured to death in Punjab raising concerns about human rights in Pakistan.', ' War starts in North-West Pakistan.[30]', ' Gunmen attack an Islamic religious gathering in Karachi, killing 8 people.', ' Former president Pervez Musharraf appeared in front of a civil court for the first time.', ' Pakistan vs India match for ICC World T20.[31]', ' Young men with guns open fire at a local court in Islamabad, resulting in at least 11 deaths and 22 injuries.', ' A Pakistani court charges former President Pervez Musharraf with high treason in relation to the imposition of the emergency rule in 2007.', ' A bomb blast in a market kills 26 people in the outskirts of Islamabad.', ' An alleged American FBI agent is arrested for carrying ammunition while trying to board a flight, which is in violation of their anti-terror laws.', ' Geo TV transmission banned by the government.[32]', ' Pakistan Air Force fighter jets bomb suspected militant hideouts in North Waziristan, killing approximately 60 militants and injuring another 30.', ' Pakistani police arrest multiple people involved in the stoning of Farzana Parveen, bringing the total number of people in custody to 12.[33]', ' The process of Long March and Sit-In started by PTI and PAT.', " Pakistan's 67th dependence day was celebrated during Long March from Lahore to Islamabad.", ' The Pakistan Television Corporation goes off air after protesters storm its headquarters.', ' A ban is imposed on Saeed Ajmal by the ICC.[34]', " Activist Malala Yousafzai becomes the first Pakistani to win the Nobel Peace Prize for her struggle to voice girls' right to education.[35]", ' More than 60 people were killed and more than 110 people were injured in a suicide attack on the Pakistan side of the Wagah border.[36]', ' Taliban gunmen storm a military-run Army Public Schools massacre in Peshawar, killing at least 141, including 132 children and nine employees, with most of five hundred students evacuated. The shooting ends with all seven gunmen dead.[37]']

[' A massive blackout strikes Pakistan, leaving as much as 80 percent of the country without electricity at its height as officials rush to restore power.[38]', " Pakistan announces the arrest of twelve Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan in relation to their alleged involvement in last year's school massacre.[39]", ' A bombing of a church in Lahore kills at least eleven people with 48 more injured.', ' Zimbabwe cricket team toured Pakistan to play International Cricket Series for the first time since 2009 attack on the Sri Lanka national cricket team.']

[' The Pakistan and India governments provided one another with a full list of nuclear sites, military and civilian, in accordance with the 1988 Non-Nuclear Aggression Agreement.[40]', ' Former president Pervez Musharraf was acquitted in the murder trial of Akbar Bugti, the Baloch tribal leader who died in a military operation in 2006.[41]', ' First season Pakistan Super League', ' Pakistan plays against India in 2016 T20 World Cup.[42]', ' Pakistan cricket star Shahid Afridi played his last international T20 match for Pakistan against Australia.[43]', ' In Punjab, 33 people died after eating sweets, accidentally tainted with insecticide.[44]', ' Musician Amjad Sabri is killed in a targeted shooting.[45]', ' At least 14 people are killed and 59 burned when a gas cylinder explosion aboard an oil tanker causes a major fire at the Gadani ship-breaking yard.[46][47][48]', ' PIA plane PK-661 crashed during flight killing 47 people including acclaimed former singer and religious scholar Junaid Jumshed and his wife.[49]']

[' A bombing at a vegetable market in Parachinar, Pakistan leads to the death of 25 people.', ' The second season of the Pakistan Super League began.[50]', ' A suicide bombing at the Shrine of Lal Shahbaz Qalander in Sehwan, Pakistan resulted in the deaths of over 90 people.[51]', " Pakistan's sixth census begins.[52]", " 16th Lux Style Awards's ceremony was held in Karachi and was hosted by Atif Aslam.", ' Pakistan wins 2017 ICC Champions Trophy defeating India in the finals.[53]', ' A unanimous verdict by the Supreme Court of Pakistan disqualifies Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif from office, over the controversy of him and some of his family members names being in the Panama Papers, thus leading to his disqualification for lifetime.[54]', ' Shahid Khaqan Abbasi is sworn in as Prime Minister, succeeding Nawaz Sharif.[55]', ' Benazir Bhutto assassination case is completed.[56]']
[' The 2018 Pakistani general elections were held.', ' former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif is sentenced to seven years']

[' Sahiwal killings[57]', ' Hub accident', ' Jammu and Kashmir airstrikes', ' Sadiqabad Railway Accident', ' Khyber Pakhtunkhwa provincial election', ' Army military plane crash', ' Pakistan earthquake', ' Train fire', ' Attack on Punjab Institute of Cardiology, Lahore.', ' Supreme Court give death sentence verdict on Gen RT. Pervez Musharraf.']

[' British Government decides to separate British India, into two sovereign Dominions of India and Pakistan.', ' Constituent Assembly of Pakistan approves the design of Pakistan.', ' The Gazette of India publishes that the first Constituent Assembly of Pakistan was given shape with 69 members (later on the membership was increased to 79), including one female member.', ' Pakistan became independent.', ' Pakistan becomes a member of the UN by a unanimous vote of the Security Council.', ' Indian Air troops land in Kashmir as the Maharajah declares accession of Kashmir to India.']

[' UNO cease-fire orders to operate in Kashmir. War stops accordingly.', ' Indo-Pakistani War of 1947, Pakistan enters war on behalf of Kashmir against India.', ' Quaid-e-Azam inaugurated the State Bank of Pakistan.', " Pakistan's first postage stamp is issued.", ' Founding father of nation Quaid-e-Azam dies in Karachi due to stroke.', ' India occupied Hyderabad Deccan and Junaghar.', ' Khwaja Nazimuddin becomes 2nd Governor-General of Pakistan.']

[' United Nations Cease-fire Line established between Pakistan Administered Kashmir (GB & AJ&K) and Indian-held Kashmir', ' Azad Kashmir Government shifts its capital to Muzaffarabad.', ' Objectives Resolution passed by Liaquat Ali Khan.']
